intro: Cacalia simulata, commonly known as the mimic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Cacalia simulata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
